result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny J Heredia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge and assessments.  All financial obligations/extradition costs to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medication.

No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with the victims.
No  contact with children under the age of 16.  Court will allow supervised contact with defendant's own children once the defendant is released from custody.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

superTimeConds.notes: With adults only, not with anyone under 16 years or vulnerable adult.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession, voting and child sex offender working with children.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 2 - 
  On motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed and read in.

Defendant sworn in. 
AS TO COUNT  1 AS AMENDED- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting and Child sex offender working with children.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Court vacated the jury trial date of 7/23/2014. 
Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-15-2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Danny J Heredia in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Danny J Heredia in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea negotiations placed on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 1 -  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(2)(a), a Class C Felony.

Attorney Kevin M Gaertner in court, defendant Danny J Heredia not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Br 12 is in trial and the state is also in trial.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/23/2014 at 8:30 a.m.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-14-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danny J Heredia in court with attorney Kevin M Gaertner.  Defendant Danny J Heredia in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Original Information filed previously.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case set for final pretrial on 6/27/2014 at 8:30 am.  Jury trial set for 7/23/2014 at 8:30 am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Any motion to be filed by 5/30/2014.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.

Attorney Kevin M Gaertner in court, defendant Danny J Heredia not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for an arraignment.  State is out of the office and court needs to also reschedule this matter.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Arraignment scheduled for 04-30-2014 at 08:30 am.
Cover letter and Information received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Danny J Heredia in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Danny J Heredia in custody.  Kevin Shomin for Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AH, JH, their residence of family, including their mother Elizabeth H.

Defendant Danny J Heredia in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Danny J Heredia in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   
DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
